results.title: Australian Weather Forecasts Under Threat From US President's Climate Cuts
results.summary: An ABC News report highlights concerns among climate scientists that budget cuts to US science agencies, particularly NOAA and NASA under President Trump, threaten the accuracy of global weather forecasts, including those in Australia. The article cites potential data loss, staff reductions, and program closures that could impact weather monitoring and research. 'We will lose forecast skill,' warns Florian Pappenberger, noting increased extreme weather events due to climate change. The article advises consulting the original source.

results.title: National Weather Service Launches Improved Severe Weather Prediction System
results.summary: The National Weather Service has launched MRMS v12.3, enhancing severe weather prediction through data integration from radar, satellite, and lightning networks since 2014. Steven Martinaitis highlights its critical role in precipitation estimates and flash flood predictability. results.title: UPSC Issue at a Glance | Uttarkashi Cloudburst: Key Facts for Prelims and Mains
results.summary: An article from The Indian Express reports on the cloudburst in Uttarkashi and its implications for UPSC exam preparation. It defines cloudbursts according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD) as exceeding 100mm of rain per hour over 20-30 sq km. The piece highlights the increased frequency of such events due to global warming and discusses the challenges in forecasting them. It also examines why cloudbursts are common in hilly areas and their link to flash floods, while urging India to enhance early warning systems, integrate ecological solutions, and prioritize community-based disaster management. Aligned with disaster awareness, but lacks explicit faith-based content.
